legal_basis: Correctional officials owe a duty of care to inmates, requiring reasonable steps to protect them from foreseeable harm. Liability arises if negligence causes damage.
decision_reasoning: Officials lacked actual knowledge of incompatibilities and followed standard procedures. Some omissions occurred but did not directly cause harm.
cause_of_action: Plaintiff was stabbed and later placed in protective custody due to perceived risks from other inmates.
procedure_followed: Trial examined actions of correctional officials at Matsqui, Mission, and Kent Institutions regarding transfers and safety measures.
result_of_case: Action dismissed with costs; no negligence established.
